poem:
Title: "In the Small Things, Brussels"

The diminutive flora,
grown in nourishing broth,
in the crevices of Brussels.
Resplendent obscurity,
touched by Bas Devos' lens
and the languishing specter of Ghost Tropic.
This is love, unshowy—
an appreciation stoked
in the steam of soup pots
and the quiet rustle of unnoticed leaves,
a city unveiled in the whispered intimacies
of its hushed corners.
